isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV) System, March 2007 and Later - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CONDENSER CORE

svcprocinfo.para: Depending on the vehicle model/engine combination, replacement of certain components may require the removal of nearby assemblies (right splash panel, fixed grille, or recirculation shield) to gain access to fittings, components, or mounting hardware. Refer to the appropriate section(s) in the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

item.para: For most under hood assemblies that may require removal, refer to the appropriate section in GROUP 09 of the Master Service Manual.

note.para: Refer to Figure 16 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Discharge A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .

Depending on vehicle model, it may be necessary to remove nearby assemblies (splash panels, fixed grille, or recirculation shield) to gain access to condenser mounting bolts and A/C lines. Refer to the appropriate section in GROUP 09 of the Master Service Manual.
If necessary, unclip or unbolt condenser line support clamps and disconnect pressure transducer wiring connector to allow A/C lines to be moved out of the way.
Disconnect A/C line fittings from condenser and position the A/C lines out of the way.
Remove condenser using one of the following methods:

item.para: Mounting style A (Figure 16): post and socket mounting.
Remove two bolts securing top mounting rail, or top mounting hangers, to radiator frame.
Lift mounting rail or hangers from top of condenser. Insure that rubber isolators remain in rail or hanger sockets.
Lift condenser from sockets in bottom rail. Insure that rubber isolators remain in rail.
Mounting style B (Figure 16): mounting tabs and bolts.
While supporting condenser, remove bolts from four condenser mounting tabs.

step1.para: Install condenser using one of the following methods:

item.para: Mounting style A (Figure 16): post and socket mounting.
Verify that rubber isolators are installed in bottom condenser support rail.
Insert posts on bottom of condenser into sockets until condenser is fully seated.
Insure that rubber isolators are installed in top rail or hanger sockets.
Install top rail, or mounting hangers, onto posts on top of condenser. Verify that posts are fully seated into sockets.
Secure top mounting rail, or top mounting hangers, to radiator frame using two bolts removed earlier.
Mounting style B (Figure 16): mounting tabs and bolts.
Using a bolt in each mounting tab secure condenser to its mounting rails.

step1.para:
If the system is to be flushed or purged, perform that operation before completing reassembly. Refer to PURGING OR FLUSHING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.

note.para: Always lubricate A/C fitting O-rings with mineral-based oil during installation.

step1.para: Using new O-rings and C-plates connect A/C line fittings to condenser. Tighten to 19,000 to 21,000 N.mm (170 to 190 lbf-in).
If removed earlier, install any condenser line support clamps in their original location and orientation. Connect wiring to pressure transducer.
Install any assemblies that were removed to gain access to the condenser.
